name: Pokemon Rainbow
description:
This is a project i'm working on for quite a while now. As a huge fan of the 1.Gen Pokémon Games and a self-tought hobby programmer, i tought it would be a good idea to recreate a game as an learning project.

My "learning project" is grown into a full blown project game and the real games i'm working on are stuck in their idea state till this one is finished :-)

And the reason i'm publishing this project of mine is, its way too sad to play and enjoy it on my own. There are so many people (Pokémon-Fans) like me that would love the idea to replay a childhood game in a slightly refurbishd edition and not an complete overhaul, to keep the original nostalgic feeling.

I'm looking forward to hear your thoughts, ideas and general feedback for this project. 

The Current State is:

  • approx. 30% of the overall world are considered finished and playable
  • the pokemon system itself is done so pokemon can be created and "live"
  • wild battle system is 50% done
  • safari battle system is 99% done
  • storysystem is 80%
  • textboxes work as in the original
  • traitors work
  • story is about 7% done
  • you can save and load your game
  • trainer battle system is the next thing to do
  • and more things i cant recall at the momemt...

The things i plan to do:

  • a player colour and some things in the game for example the bike is then coloured in this colour
  • add in deleted and beta content
  • add in mew in a place to be captured without tricks
  • add in npc's that trade the pokemon that only evolve over trade so you can complete the pokedex in singleplayer
  • add more places some even hidden
  • maybe maybe multiplayer
  • full controller support which is about 40%implemented
  • shortkeys for some item (map, bike, rod, etc)

At the current state of development i dont want to upload anything yet because the game has too much bugs and is nearly unplayable for other people.
